poem:
Title: "On the Embers of Desire"

Morning breaks, bearing the whispers
of Sappho's longing - "You Burn Me", 
A fragmented voice in this worldly pyre,
Engaged in a tantalizing ballet with death.
Oh Argentinian dream-weaver, see how love
Writhes in the crucible of humanity,
A vital quandary blasphemously simple,
Carved by the chisels of desire
Upon the marbled silence of our hearts.
